solution_line_template: If he melts them down, {quarters_per_ounce} quarters equals ${melt_value_per_ounce} because {one_ounce_for_calc} / ({quarter_weight}) = <<{one_ounce_for_calc}/{quarter_weight}={quarters_per_ounce}>>{quarters_per_ounce}

If he spends those {quarters_per_ounce} quarters they are worth ${store_value_five_quarters} because {quarters_per_ounce} x {quarter_store_value} = <<{quarters_per_ounce}*{quarter_store_value}={store_value_five_quarters}>>{store_value_five_quarters}

They are worth {melt_vs_store_ratio} times more melted down because {melt_value_per_ounce} / {store_value_five_quarters} = <<{melt_value_per_ounce}/{store_value_five_quarters}={melt_vs_store_ratio}>>{melt_vs_store_ratio}
